function.description: Finds an email message.
function.name: gmail_find_email

instructions.description: Instructions for running this tool. Any parameters that are not given a value will be guessed based on the instructions.

query.description: This is a gmail query search. Examples of queries include specifying sender (from:amy), recipient (to:david), words in the subject line (subject:dinner), matching multiple terms (from:amy OR from:david), excluding terms (dinner -movie), searching for an exact word or phrase ("dinner and movie tonight"), attachments (has:attachment, filename:pdf), labels (label:friends), and time periods (after:YYYY-MM-DD, before:YYYY-MM-DD). Users can also search by categories (category:updates), message size (larger:10M), and more. When asked vaguely to return the last, latest, or any email from their inbox, use in:inbox to do the lookup.

bcc.description: Can be comma separated. The user must provide a valid email address, do not guess or use fake email addresses like @example.com. Perhaps look it up in a CRM or contact book first?

cc.description: Can be comma separated. The user must provide a valid email address, do not guess or use fake email addresses like @example.com. Perhaps look it up in a CRM or contact book first?

send_to_groups.description: Send message to Google Contacts Group/Label

to.description: Can be comma separated. The user must provide a valid email address, do not guess or use fake email addresses like @example.com. Perhaps look it up in a CRM or contact book first?

thread_ts.description: If you want this to be part of a thread, you'll need the timestamp (Ts) of the parent message. For example: `1345232312616.1231232`.
